Don't worry, we've all been there! It's great that you're acknowledging your weakness and wanting to make a change. Balancing your sweet tooth with healthier options takes time and strategy, but with these tips, you'll be on your way:

**1. Identify your triggers:** Reflect on why you reached for the chocolate cake three times. Was it stress, boredom, or a celebration? Once you know your triggers, you can develop a plan to tackle them.

**2. Plan ahead:** If you know you'll be passing by the bakery, prepare a healthy snack or dessert in advance. This could be as simple as packing a piece of fruit, a handful of nuts, or a homemade energy ball.

**3. Find healthier alternatives:** Explore healthier dessert options that still satisfy your sweet tooth. Try fruit-based desserts, dark chocolate-dipped fruit, or homemade treats made with natural sweeteners like honey or maple syrup.

**4. Practice moderation:** Allow yourself the occasional indulgence, but set boundaries. If you do get the chocolate cake, savor a small portion and stop at one serving.

**5. Get creative at home:** Bake your own healthier desserts using whole wheat flour, less sugar, and natural sweeteners. This way, you can control the ingredients and portion sizes.

**6. Find healthy ways to cope:** Develop alternative coping mechanisms for stress, boredom, or celebrations. Try going for a walk, practicing stretching, or engaging in a hobby.

**7. Gradual change:** Don't try to quit cold turkey. Gradually reduce your sweet treats and replace them with healthier options. This will help your taste buds and body adjust.

**8. Get support:** Share your struggles with a friend or family member and ask for their support. Having someone to hold you accountable can make a big difference.

**9. Focus on addition, not subtraction:** Instead of cutting out sweets entirely, focus on adding healthier options to your diet. This mindset shift will help you feel more positive and empowered.

**10. Celebrate small wins:** Acknowledge and celebrate your small victories, even if it's just making a healthier choice once a week. This will help you stay motivated and encouraged.

Remember, balancing your sweet tooth with healthier options takes time, patience, and self-compassion. Don't be too hard on yourself if you slip up – simply get back on track and keep moving forward.
